The Chief Medical Officer (CMO) of the Frontier Service played a significant role in designing the state-of-the-art (SOTA) hospital in the colony. The CMO incorporated the guiding principles of the colony, emphasizing sustainability, environmental stewardship, and the well-being of its inhabitants.

Some of the key features of the SOTA hospital include:

1. Energy Efficiency: The hospital utilizes passive solar heating and cooling, geothermal systems, and solar panels to minimize energy consumption and reduce its carbon footprint.
2. Green Spaces: The hospital features green roofs and walls to improve air quality, reduce heat island effects, and provide a calming, natural environment for patients and staff.
3. Water Management: Advanced greywater and blackwater recycling systems are implemented to minimize water waste and promote a sustainable water cycle.
4. Sustainable Materials: The construction of the hospital prioritizes the use of eco-friendly, locally sourced, and recyclable materials to minimize its environmental impact.
5. Patient-centered Design: The hospital layout prioritizes the comfort and well-being of patients, with spacious rooms, ample natural light, and easy access to communal areas and green spaces.
6. Holistic Health Approach: The hospital focuses on a comprehensive approach to healthcare, emphasizing preventive care, mental health services, and promoting healthy lifestyles for the community.

By incorporating the guiding principles of the colony into the design of the SOTA hospital, the Chief Medical Officer has created a facility that promotes the health and well-being of the community while minimizing its environmental impact. This hospital serves as an example of how healthcare facilities can operate harmoniously within a sustainable and eco-conscious society.
